data.title: Christopher Koch, Athlete, Sabres Fan
data.meta_description: Dec. 4, 1963-April 27, 2014 East Aurora native Christopher Koch of Batavia died on Sunday, April 27, with his longtime companion Kathy Bobzin and cherished dogs, Gus and Abby, by his side. He was 50. Mr. Koch was born and raised in East Aurora, son of the late G. Fred Koch and Joanne B. Koch.
data.text:
Dec. 4, 1963-April 27, 2014

East Aurora native Christopher Koch of Batavia died on Sunday, April 27, with his longtime companion Kathy Bobzin and cherished dogs, Gus and Abby, by his side. He was 50.

Mr. Koch was born and raised in East Aurora, son of the late G. Fred Koch and Joanne B. Koch. He was an avid sports fan and an accomplished athlete. After high school Mr. Koch enlisted in the Navy and traveled the world. He received a Bachelor of Science degree from SUNY Brockport and majored in alcohol and substance abuse counseling.

Mr. Koch fought a long battle with Multiple Sclerosis, but those who knew him well know it was the Buffalo Sabresâ€™ awe-inspiring debacle of the season that really broke his heart. He had a true love for the game.

Mr. Koch is survived by siblings Fritz, Peter, Eugene (Julie), Lil, Rodney A. (Pam) Morgan and Paula Morgan; and many nieces and nephews.

Mr. Koch was a very special uncle to Emily Koch McArdle. He leaves behind his lifelong best friend, Danny McGrath, as well as Amii and Sierra Capuno; and Adam, Candace and Riley Gonzalez.

Mr. Koch was preceded in death by his parents, G. Fred and Joanne; stepmother Suzanne N. Koch; and sisters Suzanne Koch Gosman and Amy M. (Ron) Lasker.

The memorial service will be held on Saturday, May 3 at 10 a.m. at Kenneth Howe Funeral Home, 64 Maple Road.

Donations may be made to the National MS Society, P.O. Box 4527, New York, NY 10163.
